topic.name: History of Visual Art
topic.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for History of Visual Art in Fine Arts

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Pyramids and Sphinx.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name a Greek column (fancy post).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Parthenon.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify art that looks like a theater play (dramatic).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name a painting with very dark shadows and bright lights.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Palace of Versailles.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify paintings made of little dots or dabs.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name Monet and his water lilies.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify Van Gogh's 'Starry Night'.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify art made of squares and triangles (Cubism).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name a picture that looks like a dream (Surrealism).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify a Jackson Pollock drip painting.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify paintings of heroes and battles.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name pictures of scary storms or beautiful nature.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify Goya or Turner.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that Egyptians painted sideways people.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe statues that look like real people (Greek/Rome).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that Kings lived in very fancy palaces (Versailles).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe swirling lines.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that they painted outside.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe how colors mix when you stand back.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that art doesn't have to look like a photo.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe paint dripped or splashed.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that some artists liked rules (Neo) and some liked feelings (Romantic).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe statues that look like Greek ones.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Mona Lisa.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name Michelangelo as a painter and sculptor.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Last Supper painting.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the purpose of Egyptian art (for the afterlife).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between an Egyptian statue (stiff) and a Greek one (moving).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Golden Ratio in Greek design.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the technical mastery of the Ancients.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the drama and motion of Baroque art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain how Rembrandt painted light.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the excess of Rococo.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the emotional power of the Baroque aesthetic.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify art you can walk inside.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name art made of trash or lights.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify a famous public sculpture.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the goal of capturing a 'moment' of light.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain 'Plein Air' (painting in open air).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the break from the 'Academy' rules.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the revolutionary nature of the first Impressionist exhibition.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize why Picasso broke things into pieces.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain Abstract Art (colors and shapes, no story).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain Abstract Expressionism.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the intellectual rigor of early Modernism.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the return to order in Neoclassicism (Logic).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the focus on emotion and nature in Romanticism.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the role of art in political propaganda (David).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the Romantic emphasis on individual experience.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that art started looking real again.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare a Greek Temple with a Roman Arch.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the shift from Archaic to Hellenistic styles in Greece.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the propaganda function of Roman imperial art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the use of Tenebrism (extreme contrast) by Caravaggio.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the Counter-Reformation's use of art to awe.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Dutch Golden Age to Protestant values (everyday life).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that art can be an idea.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe street art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare a smooth photo-like painting with an Impressionist one.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the scientific theory of color used by Seurat (Pointillism).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret Van Gogh's brushwork as emotional expression.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect the invention of the camera to the shift away from realism.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify a castle and a church with stained glass.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Name a picture of Jesus with a gold circle (halo).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Identify a Gargoyle.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare a melting clock (Dali) with a real clock.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the fragmentation of reality in Cubism.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the psychological roots of Surrealism.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect the chaos of WWI to Dadaism.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare a painting of a general with a painting of a sunset.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the connection between Neoclassicism and the American Revolution.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the concept of the 'Sublime' in Romantic landscape.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect the industrial revolution to the Romantic backlash.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the rebirth (Renaissance) of Greek/Roman ideas.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain Linear Perspective (depth).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the 'Renaissance Man' concept.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the artistic merit of the Northern Renaissance (Van Eyck).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the Roman appropriation of Greek aesthetics.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the psychological depth of Rembrandt's self-portraits.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize 'Installation Art' (transforming a room).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain that the idea is sometimes more important than the object.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the commodification of art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the need for discernment in consuming shocking art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the influence of Japanese prints on this era.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Recall that monks made books by hand.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Observe tall pointed windows (Gothic).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the philosophy of 'Art for Art's sake'.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the shift from reason to emotion in the 19th century.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare the calm Renaissance with the busy Baroque.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the impact of Humanism on religious art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the use of Chiaroscuro by Da Vinci.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Medici family (patrons) to the art boom.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect the durability of Roman concrete to their architecture.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct a comparative analysis of the worldview of Egypt vs. Greece.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize archaeological evidence with art history.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct a comparison of Catholic Baroque (Bernini) vs. Protestant Baroque (Rembrandt).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the political power projected through Rococo ornamentation.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare a museum with an outdoor art park.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the impermanence of some contemporary art (Earthworks).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the role of the viewer in participatory art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect pop culture to Pop Art (Warhol).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct an analysis of the dissolution of form in later Monet.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the transition from perceptual (Impressionism) to conceptual (Cezanne).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the purpose of stained glass (Bible stories for those who couldn't read).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain what an Icon is.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Flying Buttress.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Defend the sophistication of 'Dark Ages' metalwork and manuscript illumination.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct a defense or critique of non-representational art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the fragmentation of the modern worldview with its art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct a critique of the Enlightenment as visualized in art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the impact of archaeology on Neoclassical design.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare Medieval art (flat) with Renaissance art (deep).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the scientific accuracy of Renaissance anatomy.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the definition of 'What is Art?' in the postmodern era.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Compare a Romanesque church (thick walls) with Gothic (light/tall).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the symbolism in Byzantine mosaics (color, size, gaze).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the theology of the Gothic Cathedral (light = God).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Connect the decline of realism to a focus on the spiritual realm.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct an argument regarding the shift from theocentric to anthropocentric art.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the integration of science, math, and art in this period.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct a critique of a contemporary exhibition.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize current trends with historical lineage.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the interplay of function and theology in medieval architecture.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Construct a profile of the Iconoclastic Controversy.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the medieval worldview through its visual culture.
